No Poverty.reason: The course focuses on rural planning and local revitalization, which may indirectly address poverty through economic development, but poverty reduction is not explicitly mentioned.

Zero Hunger.reason: No direct reference to food security or hunger; the course emphasizes spatial planning and economic industries, with no mention of agriculture or food systems.

Good Health and Well-being.reason: The course does not address health or well-being directly; the focus is on spatial planning and economic aspects of rural areas.

Quality Education.reason: The course itself is an educational program teaching field investigation and GIS skills, directly contributing to quality education for interdisciplinary students.

Gender Equality.reason: No mention of gender-related issues or equality in the course description or objectives.

Clean Water and Sanitation.reason: The course does not address water or sanitation issues; it focuses on spatial planning and economic industries.

Affordable and Clean Energy.reason: No reference to energy-related topics in the course description or objectives.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: The course includes a focus on economic industries in rural areas during the second half, directly contributing to economic growth and potentially decent work.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: The course involves GIS and spatial planning, which support infrastructure development and innovation in rural planning processes.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: Rural revitalization may indirectly reduce inequalities by improving economic conditions in underserved areas, but this is not explicitly stated.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: The course directly addresses rural planning and local revitalization, which aligns with creating sustainable communities in rural areas.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: No explicit mention of consumption or production practices; the focus is on spatial and economic planning without reference to sustainability in these areas.

Climate Action.reason: The course does not mention climate-related issues or actions; the focus is on spatial and economic planning.

Life Below Water.reason: No reference to marine ecosystems or water-related environmental issues in the course content.

Life on Land.reason: Rural planning may indirectly involve land use, but there is no explicit focus on ecosystems, biodiversity, or terrestrial environmental protection.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: No mention of governance, justice, or institutional frameworks in the course description.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: The course mentions integration with university-related units, suggesting potential partnerships, but this is not a core focus.
